intro: Cephaelis vallis, commonly known as the Valley Cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
